0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The files of this project can be used either as command-line tools or aslibraries to supplement your own work.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Basic Usage:  Command-Line Tools</h3><a id="user-content-basic-usage--command-line-tools" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Basic Usage:  Command-Line Tools" href="#basic-usage--command-line-tools"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The command-line tools are self-documented and <a href="#command-line-tools">their documentation is capturedabove</a> for easy reference.  Simply pass <code>--help</code> to them inorder to obtain the same detailed documentation.</p><p dir="auto">Please review <a href="/wwkimball/yamlpath/blob/master/tests">the comprehensive test_commands_*.py unit tests</a> toexplore samples of YAML files and the many ways these tools help get and settheir data.</p><p dir="auto">The following are some simple examples of their typical use-cases.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Rotate Your EYAML Keys</h4><a id="user-content-rotate-your-eyaml-keys" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Rotate Your EYAML Keys" href="#rotate-your-eyaml-keys"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">If the eyaml command is already on your PATH (if not, be sure to also supplythe optional <code>--eyaml</code> or <code>-x</code> argument):</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="eyaml-rotate-keys \  --oldprivatekey=~/old-keys/private_key.pkcs7.pem \  --oldpublickey=~/old-keys/public_key.pkcs7.pem \  --newprivatekey=~/new-keys/private_key.pkcs7.pem \  --newpublickey=~/new-keys/public_key.pkcs7.pem \  my_1st_yaml_file.yaml my_2nd_yaml_file.eyaml ... my_Nth_yaml_file.yaml"><pre>eyaml-rotate-keys \  --oldprivatekey=<span class="pl-k">~</span>/old-keys/private_key.pkcs7.pem \  --oldpublickey=<span class="pl-k">~</span>/old-keys/public_key.pkcs7.pem \  --newprivatekey=<span class="pl-k">~</span>/new-keys/private_key.pkcs7.pem \  --newpublickey=<span class="pl-k">~</span>/new-keys/public_key.pkcs7.pem \  my_1st_yaml_file.yaml my_2nd_yaml_file.eyaml ... my_Nth_yaml_file.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">You could combine this with <code>find</code> and <code>xargs</code> if your E/YAML file aredispersed through a directory hierarchy, as with Hiera data.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Get the Differences Between Two Documents</h4><a id="user-content-get-the-differences-between-two-documents" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Get the Differences Between Two Documents" href="#get-the-differences-between-two-documents"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">For routine use:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-diff yaml_file1.yaml yaml_file2.yaml"><pre>yaml-diff yaml_file1.yaml yaml_file2.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">Output is very similar to that of standard GNU diff against text files, exceptit is generated against the <em>data</em> within the input files.  This excludesevaluating purely structural and immaterial differences between them like valuedemarcation, white-space, and comments.  When you need to evaluate the twofiles as if they were just text files, use GNU diff or any of its clones.</p><p dir="auto">To see all identical entries along with differences:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-diff --same yaml_file1.yaml yaml_file2.yaml"><pre>yaml-diff --same yaml_file1.yaml yaml_file2.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">To see <em>only</em> entries which are identical between the documents:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-diff --onlysame yaml_file1.yaml yaml_file2.yaml"><pre>yaml-diff --onlysame yaml_file1.yaml yaml_file2.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">Advanced:  Arrays can be evaluated such that they are synchronized beforeevaluation.  Rather than compare elements by identical index in bothdocuments -- reporting differences between them as changes and any additionalelements as additions or deletions -- they can instead be compared by matchingup all identical elements and then reporting only those values which are uniqueto either document (and optionally identical matches).</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-diff --sync-arrays yaml_file1.yaml yaml_file2.yaml"><pre>yaml-diff --sync-arrays yaml_file1.yaml yaml_file2.yaml</pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Get a YAML/JSON/Compatible Value</h4><a id="user-content-get-a-yamljsoncompatible-value" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Get a YAML/JSON/Compatible Value" href="#get-a-yamljsoncompatible-value"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">At its simplest:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-get \  --query=see.documentation.above.for.many.samples \  my_yaml_file.yaml"><pre>yaml-get \  --query=see.documentation.above.for.many.samples \  my_yaml_file.yaml</pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Search For YAML Paths</h4><a id="user-content-search-for-yaml-paths" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Search For YAML Paths" href="#search-for-yaml-paths"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Simplest use:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-paths \  --search=%word \  /some/directory/*.yaml"><pre>yaml-paths \  --search=%word \  /some/directory/<span class="pl-k">*</span>.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">Search for multiple expressions and exclude unwanted results:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-paths \  --search=^another \  --search=$word \  --except=%bad \  /some/directory/*.yaml"><pre>yaml-paths \  --search=^another \  --search=<span class="pl-smi">$word</span> \  --except=%bad \  /some/directory/<span class="pl-k">*</span>.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">Return all leaf nodes under matching parents (most useful when matching against Hash keys and you only want the original leaf nodes beneath them):</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-paths \  --expand \  --keynames \  --search==parent_node \  /some/directory/*.yaml"><pre>yaml-paths \  --expand \  --keynames \  --search==parent_node \  /some/directory/<span class="pl-k">*</span>.yaml</pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Change a YAML/JSON/Compatible Value</h4><a id="user-content-change-a-yamljsoncompatible-value" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Change a YAML/JSON/Compatible Value" href="#change-a-yamljsoncompatible-value"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">For a no-frills change to a YAML file with deeply nested Hash structures:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-set \  --change=see.documentation.above.for.many.samples \  --value="New Value" \  my_yaml_file.yaml"><pre>yaml-set \  --change=see.documentation.above.for.many.samples \  --value=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>New Value<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> \  my_yaml_file.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">To rotate a password, preserving the old password perhaps so your automation canapply the new password to your application(s):</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-set \  --mustexist \  --change=the.new.password \  --saveto=the.old.password \  --value="New Password" \  my_yaml_file.yaml"><pre>yaml-set \  --mustexist \  --change=the.new.password \  --saveto=the.old.password \  --value=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>New Password<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> \  my_yaml_file.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">For the extremely cautious, you could check the old password before rotatingit and save a backup of the original file:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-set \  --mustexist \  --change=the.new.password \  --saveto=the.old.password \  --check="Old Password" \  --value="New Password" \  --backup \  my_yaml_file.yaml"><pre>yaml-set \  --mustexist \  --change=the.new.password \  --saveto=the.old.password \  --check=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Old Password<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> \  --value=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>New Password<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> \  --backup \  my_yaml_file.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">You can also add EYAML encryption (assuming the <code>eyaml</code> command is on yourPATH; if not, you can pass <code>--eyaml</code> to specify its location).  In this example,I add the optional <code>--format=folded</code> so that the long EYAML value is broken upinto a multi-line value rather than one very long string.  This is the preferredformat for human legibility as well as EYAML consumers like<a href="http://puppet.com" rel="nofollow">Puppet</a>.  Note that <code>--format</code> has several other settingsand applies only to new values.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-set \  --change=the.new.password \  --mustexist \  --saveto=the.old.password \  --check="Old Password" \  --value="New Password" \  --eyamlcrypt \  --format=folded \  --backup \  my_yaml_file.yaml"><pre>yaml-set \  --change=the.new.password \  --mustexist \  --saveto=the.old.password \  --check=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Old Password<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> \  --value=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>New Password<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> \  --eyamlcrypt \  --format=folded \  --backup \  my_yaml_file.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">You can even tell EYAML which keys to use, if not your default system or userkeys:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-set \  --change=the.new.password \  --mustexist \  --saveto=the.old.password \  --check="Old Password" \  --value="New Password" \  --eyamlcrypt \  --format=folded \  --privatekey=/secret/keys/private_key.pkcs7.pem \  --publickey=/secret/keys/public_key.pkcs7.pem \  --backup \  my_yaml_file.yaml"><pre>yaml-set \  --change=the.new.password \  --mustexist \  --saveto=the.old.password \  --check=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Old Password<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> \  --value=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>New Password<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> \  --eyamlcrypt \  --format=folded \  --privatekey=/secret/keys/private_key.pkcs7.pem \  --publickey=/secret/keys/public_key.pkcs7.pem \  --backup \  my_yaml_file.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">Note that for even greater security scenarios, you can keep the new value off ofyour command-line, process list, and command history by swapping out <code>--value</code>for one of <code>--stdin</code>, <code>--file</code>, or even <code>--random LENGTH</code> (use Python'sstrongest random value generator if you don't need to specify the replacementvalue in advance).</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Merge YAML/JSON/Compatible Files</h4><a id="user-content-merge-yamljsoncompatible-files" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Merge YAML/JSON/Compatible Files" href="#merge-yamljsoncompatible-files"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">At its simplest, the <code>yaml-merge</code> command accepts two or more input files andmerges them together from left-to-right, writing the result to STDOUT:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-merge leftmost.yaml middle.yaml right.json"><pre>yaml-merge leftmost.yaml middle.yaml right.json</pre></div><p dir="auto">If you'd rather write the results to a new output file (which must not alreadyexist):</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-merge \  --output=newfile.yaml \  leftmost.yaml \  middle.yaml \  right.json"><pre>yaml-merge \  --output=newfile.yaml \  leftmost.yaml \  middle.yaml \  right.json</pre></div><p dir="auto">Should you wish to merge the content of the files into a specific location (oreven multiple locations) within the leftmost document, specify a YAML Path viathe <code>--mergeat</code> or <code>-m</code> argument:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-merge \  --mergeat=/anywhere/within/the/document \  leftmost.yaml \  middle.yaml \  right.json"><pre>yaml-merge \  --mergeat=/anywhere/within/the/document \  leftmost.yaml \  middle.yaml \  right.json</pre></div><p dir="auto">To write arbitrary data from STDIN into a document, use the <code>-</code> pseudo-file:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="echo "{arbitrary: [document, structure]}" | yaml-merge target.yaml -"><pre><span class="pl-c1">echo</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>{arbitrary: [document, structure]}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> <span class="pl-k">|</span> yaml-merge target.yaml -</pre></div><p dir="auto">Combine <code>--mergeat</code> or <code>-m</code> with the STDIN pseudo-file to control where thedata is to be written:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="echo "{arbitrary: [document, structure]}" | \  yaml-merge \    --mergeat=/anywhere/within/the/document \    target.yaml -"><pre><span class="pl-c1">echo</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>{arbitrary: [document, structure]}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> <span class="pl-k">|</span> \  yaml-merge \    --mergeat=/anywhere/within/the/document \    target.yaml -</pre></div><p dir="auto">There are many options for precisely controlling how the merge is performed,including the ability to specify complex rules on a YAML Path basis via aconfiguration file.  Review the command's <code>--help</code> or the<a href="https://github.com/wwkimball/yamlpath/wiki/yaml-merge">related Wiki</a> formore detail.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Validate YAML/JSON/Compatible Documents</h4><a id="user-content-validate-yamljsoncompatible-documents" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Validate YAML/JSON/Compatible Documents" href="#validate-yamljsoncompatible-documents"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Validating the structure of YAML, JSON, and compatible files is as simple asrunning:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="yaml-validate /path/to/any/files.yaml /path/to/more/files.json"><pre>yaml-validate /path/to/any/files.yaml /path/to/more/files.json</pre></div><p dir="auto">In this default configuration, the command will output no report when all inputdocuments are valid.  It will also report an exit-state of zero (0).  Shouldthere be any validation errors, each will be printed to the screen and theexit-state will be 2.  An exit-state of 1 means your command-line argumentswere incorrect and an appropritae user error message will be displayed.</p><p dir="auto">When there are validation issues, the offending file-name(s) and sub-documentindex(es) (zero-based) will be displayed along with a detailed validation errormessage.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Basic Usage:  Libraries</h3><a id="user-content-basic-usage--libraries" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Basic Usage:  Libraries" href="#basic-usage--libraries"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">As for the libraries, they are also heavily documented and the exampleimplementations may perhaps serve as good copy-paste fodder (provided you givecredit to the source).  That said, here's a general flow/synopsis.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Initialize ruamel.yaml and These Helpers</h4><a id="user-content-initialize-ruamelyaml-and-these-helpers" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Initialize ruamel.yaml and These Helpers" href="#initialize-ruamelyaml-and-these-helpers"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Your preferences may differ, but I use this setup for round-trip YAML parsingand editing with ruamel.yaml.  When you need to process EYAML encrypted data,replace <code>yamlpath.Processor</code> with <code>yamlpath.eyaml.EYAMLProcessor</code> and add errorhandling for <code>yamlpath.eyaml.EYAMLCommandException</code>.</p><p dir="auto">Note also that these examples use <code>ConsolePrinter</code> to handle STDOUT and STDERRmessaging.  You don't have to.  However, some kind of logger must be passed tothese libraries so they can write messages <em>somewhere</em>.  Your custom messagehandler or logger must provide the same API as <code>ConsolePrinter</code>; review theheader documentation in <a href="/wwkimball/yamlpath/blob/master/yamlpath/wrappers/consoleprinter.py">consoleprinter.py</a>for details.  Generally speaking, it would be trivial to write your own customwrapper for Python's standard logging facilities if you require targets otherthan STDOUT and STDERR.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from types import SimpleNamespacefrom yamlpath.common import Parsersfrom yamlpath.wrappers import ConsolePrinterfrom yamlpath import Processor# The various classes of this library must be able to write messages somewhere# when things go bad.  This project provides a CLI-centric logging class named# ConsolePrinter.  Even when not writing a CLI tool, you must still configure# and pass ConsolePrinter or a class of your own with the same public API.  For# just muting logging output -- except for unrecoverable errors -- you can use# this simple configuration object:logging_args = SimpleNamespace(quiet=True, verbose=False, debug=False)log = ConsolePrinter(logging_args)# Prep the YAML parser and round-trip editor (tweak to your needs).  You do not# have to use Parsers.get_yaml_editor() but you must create a properly-# configured instance of ruamel.yaml.YAML.yaml = Parsers.get_yaml_editor()# At this point, you'd load or parse your YAML file, stream, or string.  This# example demonstrates loading YAML data from an external file.  You could also# use the same function to load data from STDIN or even a String variable.  See# the Parser class for more detail.yaml_file = "your-file.yaml"(yaml_data, doc_loaded) = Parsers.get_yaml_data(yaml, log, yaml_file)if not doc_loaded:    # There was an issue loading the file; an error message has already been    # printed via ConsolePrinter.    exit(1)# Pass the logging facility and parsed YAML data to the YAMLPath Processorprocessor = Processor(log, yaml_data)# At this point, the Processor is ready to handle YAML Paths"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">types</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">SimpleNamespace</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">yamlpath</span>.<span class="pl-s1">common</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">Parsers</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">yamlpath</span>.<span class="pl-s1">wrappers</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">ConsolePrinter</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">yamlpath</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">Processor</span><span class="pl-c"># The various classes of this library must be able to write messages somewhere</span><span class="pl-c"># when things go bad.  This project provides a CLI-centric logging class named</span><span class="pl-c"># ConsolePrinter.  Even when not writing a CLI tool, you must still configure</span><span class="pl-c"># and pass ConsolePrinter or a class of your own with the same public API.  For</span><span class="pl-c"># just muting logging output -- except for unrecoverable errors -- you can use</span><span class="pl-c"># this simple configuration object:</span><span class="pl-s1">logging_args</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">SimpleNamespace</span>(<span class="pl-s1">quiet</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">True</span>, <span class="pl-s1">verbose</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">False</span>, <span class="pl-s1">debug</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">False</span>)<span class="pl-s1">log</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">ConsolePrinter</span>(<span class="pl-s1">logging_args</span>)<span class="pl-c"># Prep the YAML parser and round-trip editor (tweak to your needs).  You do not</span><span class="pl-c"># have to use Parsers.get_yaml_editor() but you must create a properly-</span><span class="pl-c"># configured instance of ruamel.yaml.YAML.</span><span class="pl-s1">yaml</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Parsers</span>.<span class="pl-en">get_yaml_editor</span>()<span class="pl-c"># At this point, you'd load or parse your YAML file, stream, or string.  This</span><span class="pl-c"># example demonstrates loading YAML data from an external file.  You could also</span><span class="pl-c"># use the same function to load data from STDIN or even a String variable.  See</span><span class="pl-c"># the Parser class for more detail.</span><span class="pl-s1">yaml_file</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s">"your-file.yaml"</span>(<span class="pl-s1">yaml_data</span>, <span class="pl-s1">doc_loaded</span>) <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Parsers</span>.<span class="pl-en">get_yaml_data</span>(<span class="pl-s1">yaml</span>, <span class="pl-s1">log</span>, <span class="pl-s1">yaml_file</span>)<span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-c1">not</span> <span class="pl-s1">doc_loaded</span>:    <span class="pl-c"># There was an issue loading the file; an error message has already been</span>    <span class="pl-c"># printed via ConsolePrinter.</span>    <span class="pl-en">exit</span>(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>)<span class="pl-c"># Pass the logging facility and parsed YAML data to the YAMLPath Processor</span><span class="pl-s1">processor</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Processor</span>(<span class="pl-s1">log</span>, <span class="pl-s1">yaml_data</span>)<span class="pl-c"># At this point, the Processor is ready to handle YAML Paths</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Searching for YAML Nodes</h4><a id="user-content-searching-for-yaml-nodes" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Searching for YAML Nodes" href="#searching-for-yaml-nodes"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">These libraries use <a href="https://wiki.python.org/moin/Generators" rel="nofollow">Generators</a> to getnodes from parsed YAML data.  Identify which node(s) to get via YAML Pathstrings.  You should also catch <code>yamlpath.exceptions.YAMLPathException</code>sunless you prefer Python's native stack traces.  When using EYAML, you shouldalso catch <code>yamlpath.eyaml.exceptions.EYAMLCommandException</code>s for the samereason.  Whether you are working with a single result or many, you shouldconsume the Generator output with a pattern similar to:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from yamlpath import YAMLPathfrom yamlpath.exceptions import YAMLPathExceptionyaml_path = YAMLPath("see.documentation.above.for.many.samples")try:    for node_coordinate in processor.get_nodes(yaml_path, mustexist=True):        log.debug("Got {} from '{}'.".format(node_coordinate, yaml_path))        # Do something with each node_coordinate.node (the actual data)except YAMLPathException as ex:    # If merely retrieving data, this exception may be deemed non-critical    # unless your later code absolutely depends upon a result.    log.error(ex)"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">yamlpath</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">YAMLPath</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">yamlpath</span>.<span class="pl-s1">exceptions</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">YAMLPathException</span><span class="pl-s1">yaml_path</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">YAMLPath</span>(<span class="pl-s">"see.documentation.above.for.many.samples"</span>)<span class="pl-k">try</span>:    <span class="pl-k">for</span> <span class="pl-s1">node_coordinate</span> <span class="pl-c1">in</span> <span class="pl-s1">processor</span>.<span class="pl-en">get_nodes</span>(<span class="pl-s1">yaml_path</span>, <span class="pl-s1">mustexist</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">True</span>):        <span class="pl-s1">log</span>.<span class="pl-en">debug</span>(<span class="pl-s">"Got {} from '{}'."</span>.<span class="pl-en">format</span>(<span class="pl-s1">node_coordinate</span>, <span class="pl-s1">yaml_path</span>))        <span class="pl-c"># Do something with each node_coordinate.node (the actual data)</span><span class="pl-k">except</span> <span class="pl-v">YAMLPathException</span> <span class="pl-k">as</span> <span class="pl-s1">ex</span>:    <span class="pl-c"># If merely retrieving data, this exception may be deemed non-critical</span>    <span class="pl-c"># unless your later code absolutely depends upon a result.</span>    <span class="pl-s1">log</span>.<span class="pl-en">error</span>(<span class="pl-s1">ex</span>)</pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Changing Values</h4><a id="user-content-changing-values" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Changing Values" href="#changing-values"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">At its simplest, you only need to supply the the YAML Path to one or more nodesto update, and the value to apply to them.  Catching<code>yamlpath.exceptions.YAMLPathException</code> is optional but usually preferred overallowing Python to dump the call stack in front of your users.  When usingEYAML, the same applies to <code>yamlpath.eyaml.exceptions.EYAMLCommandException</code>.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from yamlpath.exceptions import YAMLPathExceptiontry:    processor.set_value(yaml_path, new_value)except YAMLPathException as ex:    log.critical(ex, 119)except EYAMLCommandException as ex:    log.critical(ex, 120)"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">yamlpath</span>.<span class="pl-s1">exceptions</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">YAMLPathException</span><span class="pl-k">try</span>:    <span class="pl-s1">processor</span>.<span class="pl-en">set_value</span>(<span class="pl-s1">yaml_path</span>, <span class="pl-s1">new_value</span>)<span class="pl-k">except</span> <span class="pl-v">YAMLPathException</span> <span class="pl-k">as</span> <span class="pl-s1">ex</span>:    <span class="pl-s1">log</span>.<span class="pl-en">critical</span>(<span class="pl-s1">ex</span>, <span class="pl-c1">119</span>)<span class="pl-k">except</span> <span class="pl-v">EYAMLCommandException</span> <span class="pl-k">as</span> <span class="pl-s1">ex</span>:    <span class="pl-s1">log</span>.<span class="pl-en">critical</span>(<span class="pl-s1">ex</span>, <span class="pl-c1">120</span>)</pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Merging Documents</h4><a id="user-content-merging-documents" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Merging Documents" href="#merging-documents"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">A document merge naturally requires at least two documents.  At the code-level,this means two populated DOM objects (populated instances of <code>yaml_data</code> fromabove).  You do not need to use a <code>Processor</code> for merging.  In the least amountof code, a merge looks like:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from yamlpath.exceptions import YAMLPathExceptionfrom yamlpath.merger.exceptions import MergeExceptionfrom yamlpath.merger import Merger, MergerConfig# Obtain or build the lhs_data and rhs_data objects using get_yaml_data or# equivalent.# You'll still need to supply a logger and some arguments used by the merge# engine.
